items.preText: We're all set Our US readers can watch the match LIVE HERE Liton Das to keep wickets for Bangladesh New Zealand XI: Guptill, Nicholls, Munro, Taylor, Latham (Capt), de Grandhomme, Neesham, Santner, Ferguson, Boult, Southee Bangladesh XI: Tamim, Liton (wk), Soumya Sarkar, Mushfiqur, Mahmudullah, Sabbir, Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Saifuddin, Mashrafe (capt), Rubel, Mustafizur Radwoan : "Rubel In for Mithun means Bangladesh playing with five bowlers! A brave call considering the batting display so far on the tour but a good one I kind of like it. " RP: "Stat question: What is Tom Latham's record as captain ? " Quite impressive, however, there's a little snag: under Latham, New Zealand have won five ODIs, there's been one no result, and they've lost one, incidentally against Bangladesh in Dublin in May 2017 10.30 Bangladesh have won the toss and will finally have a bowl first in the series. One change for them, as Rubel Hossain comes in for Mohammad Mithun. Three changes for New Zealand. Astle out, Satner in Williamson out, Munro in and Henry out, Southee in Montaz Ali Bulb: "Its 3.20 am right now at bangladesh. But still waiting to watch the game. " Montaz Ali Bulb: "Bangladesh should play attacking cricket here. They don't need to take pressure. Lost this match dosen't effect but if they win it will great pleasure for us. " 10.20 Meanwhile, if you were having any trouble waking up, this should help: Oman slumped to the fourth-lowest List-A score in cricket history, after they were bowled out by Scotland for only 24 runs in Al Amerat. Saleque Sufi: "Can Bangladesh bounce back like injured tigers or succumb to yet another series white wash? Very steep challenge ? But for that to happen Tamim, Mushfique and Mahmudullah need to play to their reputation , Mustafiz , Rubel and Mashrafee have to take wickets " 10.00am Hello and welcome to our coverage of the third and final ODI between New Zealand and Bangladesh. For a sport constantly grappling with the idea of context, this is a beautiful time. With the World Cup less than a hundred days away, there are no dead rubbers, and that augers well for this third ODI despite New Zealand's unassailable lead in the series. Another chance for Bangladesh to win their first match of any kind against New Zealand, in New Zealand. Can Martin Guptill become the first from his country to hammer three hundreds in a bilateral series? Mohammad Isam has more in his preview. Bangaladesh will be without their best batsman of the series, Mohammad Mithun, out with an injury, and Mushfiqur Rahim is a doubtful starter as well. For New Zealand Colin Munro replaces Kane Williamson, who is having a rest. Their batting hasn't been challenged yet because their bowling's been in sparkling form, and one of the fastest bowlers going around, Lockie Ferguson has been a major reason for their success

items.preText: Sanyat11: "What's with this two teams? Seems like they happen to get washed in their away series against each other... "
items.text: full on the pads, tucked away to fine-leg to get his innings going. Looks like an easy paced pitch so far

items.text: full on off, just a gentle push but impeccable timing teases the mid-off fielder all the way down to the boundary, who saves one with a slide, pick up and throw

items.preText: Pollock: "Masrafee has been inspirational. But he has to prove himself as a bowler. His bowling lack penetration. He deserve a chance to lead worlcup. But in world cup inspiration will go vain if you become liabilities. i hope cricinfo this time publish this post. True supporter became critical. Blind Mash fan need to understand."

items.preText: Abdullah: "@Pollock, nation's highest wicket taker has not proved himself? After multiple injuries he lead the country to lot a huge victories, including his local league teams. I am not his biggest fan, but what you said, I cannot agree with it at all. He cannot give anything more than he has already. He always picks up wicket at crucial moments, just not working for him in this series, or any Bangladeshi bowlers in NZ. "
items.text: full on middle and Guptill goes through the line to launch it over the bowler's head for a massive six. Held his shape beautifully for the cameras as he completed that shot, which wasn't much more than an extension of a forward defence
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, SIX runs

items.text: length outside off, quicker from Mustafizur this time, punched to cover

items.text: length outside off, bit of width and Guptill, with the form he is in pounces on it, as he rocks back and punches it through the covers
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, FOUR runs

items.text: big appeal and given. Munro had been flirting with danger, shuffling across and trying to play through the leg side, this time it nipped back into him and given the relative lack of bounce, struck on the knee roll, caught plumb in front
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Munro, OUT

dismissal.text: C Munro lbw b Mashrafe Mortaza 8 (16m 7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 114.28
